meanings.sent1: The sobber was comforted by their friend.
meanings.sent2: I saw a sobber at the funeral yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The little sobber in the movie made everyone feel sad.
meanings.sent4: She was a sobber, her tears flowing like a river.

meanings.definition: To cry noisily, taking in short, sudden breaths.
meanings.sent1: When she heard the news, she began to sobber uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The child started to sobber after dropping his ice cream.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to sobber playfully as it chased its tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to sobber as rain poured down.
meanings.sent5: The old man would sobber quietly every night, missing his wife.
